intro: Gnidia propinqua, commonly known as the African starwood, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has smooth, dark green leaves and produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Gnidia propinqua is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some regions.
